attributes.title: How Lombardi's Pizza Is Made
attributes.description:
Created on April 25, 2011 by bf701 on Sourcemap.org:

Reference: Mike Giammarino, Lombardi's owner

attributes.name: How Lombardi's Pizza Is Made
attributes.1: 32 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
attributes.address: 32 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
attributes.title: How Lombardi's Pizza Is Made

attributes.name: Flour
attributes.title: Flour
attributes.description: "Most of our flour is coming in from the midwest, as far as we're told." - Mike Giammarino

attributes.name: San Marzano Tomatoes
attributes.1: 74020 San Marzano di San Giuseppe Taranto, Italy
attributes.address: 74020 San Marzano di San Giuseppe Taranto, Italy
attributes.title: San Marzano Tomatoes
attributes.description: "Sometimes we're able to get them from Italy and other times we source domestically." - Mike Giammarino

attributes.name: Mozzarella
attributes.1: 188 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
attributes.address: 188 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
attributes.title: Mozzarella
attributes.description: "We use mom and pop cheese shops that use whole milk mozzarella... Most likely they are starting with a curd product that comes from a farm in Upstate New York." - Mike Giammarino

attributes.name: Olive Oil
attributes.title: Olive Oil
attributes.description: "We use an extra virgin olive oil--no particular brand. We end up throughout year switching off because it has a high price swing. We use half a dozen oils. Most are from Italy. We might have seen one from California." - Mike Giammarino

attributes.name: Coal
attributes.title: Coal
attributes.description: "We use 100 lbs of coal a day" to heat the oven - Mike Giammarino
